name: The Falcondale Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel stands in loveley landscaped grounds and from the road its imposing fascade givs a glimpse of what to expect. The rooms are styled in contemporary fashion with good sied bathrooms. The service is quiet and friendly and the food lovely. The seven course taster is well worth trying but though portions are not huge as it is a taster menu, by the end you will feel you have over eaten!! It is possible tto walk into Lampeter from the hotel and it is a typical little country town. There is some lovely countryside to be seen in the area and a visit to Narbeth is a must, stopping to see the Colby Woodland Gardens en route.
reviews.title: Olde world charm with contemporary style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was 3pm. We arrived at 2pm.
reviews.title: An excellent break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by Meleri and I announced we were a little early.
reviews.title: Still Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were, in fact, a day early - I'd got the date wrong. Great start! I was already adding the cost of a local B&B to the "bargain break".
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted to hear that this didn't bother Meleri and she offered us the glass of bubbly whilst they sorted out the problem.
reviews.title: Hats off to the Chef

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a very relaxing hotel with very good staff. the hotel had the extra touches like a dvd player in the room with an exceptional breakfast that set you up for the day to tour the surrounding countryside The only downside was the noise from the kitchen extractor but that was only on for the least amount of time and I believe only affected room 5
reviews.title: relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Chance visit, I was in Lampeter for work and couldn't find a place to stay.
reviews.title: Fab, friendly and stunning hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Exceptionally friendly staff and the room was a delight. Really nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Welcome Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fab bath products you'll want to take away with you !.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed was one of the dreamiest ive slept in. Amazing nights sleep.
reviews.title: Relaxing bargain break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a 2 night stay including taster meal, bought via groupon. We didn't upgrade to a "better" or "best" room, luckily we found the "standard" room adequate in every way. BUT to note i am used to a king sized bed at home and the double in this room did feel very small, so i didn't sleep very well, but this isn't the hotels fault at all- more me being fussy. The bed was comfy and supportive. Having said that if you are like me and like to stretch out - it may be worth seeing if the upgraded rooms have larger beds?
reviews.title: Stunning views, a great getaway from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel surroundings are fabulous and you immediately feel relaxed on arrival. The free glass of prosecco we were given aided this too! Pleasant and friendly staff. Everywhere was clean and tidy. I loved the toiletries in the room, Temple-spa, very impressive!
reviews.title: University Memorial

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were delicious and there was plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a negative note- we couldn't drink the coffee in the room, it was awful. We were very disappointed in the taster menu. We often try taster menus when we go out and we've never had such a poor one. I can only assume that because it was part of a groupon deal, somehow corners had been cut, there is no way you would want to pay £65 for it. We found 5 out of 7 courses completely tasteless, including the lamb course, which you would expect to be fantastic- being surrounded by sheep!
reviews.title: So much needs to be done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only other thing we disliked was the awful background "music" it was like a tap dripping or something else annoying and tuneless. Please please sort the music out.
reviews.title: a nice get-away...but wouldn't rush back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights inbetween christmas and new year.
reviews.title: wonderful welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Welcome was warm and very friendly, rooms were extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: A lovely treat......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Enjoyed sitting infront of the open fire with a drink. Very relaxing
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading such good reviews we booked a 2 nights stay through Groupon to celebrate both my Dad and my Birthday. Before booking I rang the hotel to confirm our requirements as my Dad has walking difficulties. It was suggested I paid an extra £45 to upgrade his room to a suite. The room was by a lift ,had a huge superking bed, a walk in shower, 2 bathrooms and a lounge area, it was worth every penny. From the moment we arrived the staff gave us the highest standerd of customer service, nothing at all was too much trouble. The 7 course taster menu was certainly a fine dining experience and delicious. The wine selection was also very good.
reviews.title: Superb, fantastic location and great service!

description: The Falcondale hotel and 2AA rosette restaurant near the University town of Lampeter is only 30 minutes from the coastal villages of Cardigan Bay and hilly, marshy regions of the Cambrian Mountains. A wealth of walking, cycling, fishing, and open gardens within easy reach of this central location in Wales. Why not visit the local National Trust before sinking into a warm, comfy sofa in the lounge with a glass, or two, of wine.
